## DisplayContainer.addRange() method

Add a named array of child objects, with optional display options.

**Signature:**

```typescript
addRange(name: string, objects: GameObject[], options?: IRangeDisplayOptions): IDisplayChild[];
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  name | string | Name to give this array of children, to be used later with <code>get(name, index)</code>. |
|  objects | [GameObject](./bge-core.gameobject.md)<!-- -->\[\] | Array of objects to add as children. |
|  options | [IRangeDisplayOptions](./bge-core.irangedisplayoptions.md) | _(Optional)_ Optional options to use when arranging these children. |

**Returns:**

[IDisplayChild](./bge-core.idisplaychild.md)<!-- -->\[\]

An array of objects containing each child, with their associated display options.
